locutie.beschrijving: The sermon addresses the historical reliability of the Bible and Paul's witness to the Resurrection, contrasting modern skepticism with the 'miraculous revelation' of Christ's victory over death.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong focus on the logical structure of Paul's argument (if/then) and the historical context of his apostolic authority.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the truth of the Resurrection and defending the reliability of the apostolic witness against modern 'Bible-debunkers'.
voorbeelden: Paul makes some very big claims
He simply declares that something happened
The story of Paul is really the story of God

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To convince the hearer of the objective reality of the Resurrection and to encourage them to stand firm against cultural skepticism.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low; the focus is on the historical 'fact' and the preacher's defense rather than the Spirit's current agency.

voorbeelden: The Exodus did not happen as described
It is an announcement about events that happened
You... must shoulder most of the responsibility
It all reminds me of the words of the Gershwin song
I hope you can feel his energy
In the Resurrection day we shall see it face to face
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; the promises are mostly quoted from the text or placed in the future, rather than enacted in the present.

voorbeelden: as we now declare it to you today
The inexorability of Death has been reversed
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; the preacher claims to 'declare' but often frames it as a report of what Paul declared.

indicatoren: Biographical story of Cook Kimball used as an illustration of faith rather than a vehicle for a present promise
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a historical debate or a witness to someone else's faith.

missende_elementen: Present-tense promise to the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about the Resurrection is provided, but the Resurrection is not 'done' to the hearer.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The 'toezegging' (promise) is buried at the very end and framed as a general truth.
voorbeelden: It is so by the miraculous intervention of our God who has not abandoned us to the grave.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal anecdotes and academic reflections.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly used to challenge the congregation's responsibility or to ask rhetorical questions.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low; used more for moral directive than sacramental promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Talking about Paul, Cook Kimball, archaeologists, and 'the Bible-debunkers'.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical narrative of Paul and the book review.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about the nature of the Gospel.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final 'Amen' and the closing declaration.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from Assertive (The Bible is true/Resurrection happened) to Directive (You must shoulder responsibility/Don't believe in vain).
voorbeelden: Every sermon... is a precious opportunity to strike a blow... You... must shoulder most of the responsibility.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative is not grounded in a present-tense declarative of grace, but in a historical defense of truth.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Missing the move from explanation to personal address of promise.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Because the Resurrection is true (Indicative), you must work overtime to teach your children (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as an apologetic lecture. It defends the 'fact' of the Resurrection against modernism but fails to enact the Resurrection as a present event for the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ died. He was dead and buried...

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The authors of The Bible Unearthed... show great reverence...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much time spent on the 'talking about' the problem rather than 'doing' the solution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a report of an event (Paul's conversion, Cook's death) rather than being an event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a reporter of Paul's authority rather than speaking with delegated authority to the 'you' in the pews.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the object of the talk, not the subject of the speaking.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as an attorney for Paul than a mandatory of Christ.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is sought through logical argument and emotional storytelling.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as an 'opportunity to strike a blow' (rhetorical tool) rather than a means of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: every sermon... is a precious opportunity to strike a blow

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by 3rd person past-tense verbs. It needs a shift to 2nd person present-tense performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Christ died for your sins, [Name/Congregation], and I declare to you today that you are forgiven.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general fact (Assertive) to a personal reality (Declarative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is a quote from a dead man (Cook/Paul) rather than a living word.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the Cook Kimball story not as an ending, but as a locutionary base for a direct commissive.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is raised, I promise you: death will not have the last word in your life.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation as the primary subjects of the Resurrection power.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are no longer in your sins.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative (teach your kids) is a burden because the indicative (you are alive in Christ) isn't personally applied.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the duty of parents in the gift of the Resurrection.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating and homiletically well-structured as a narrative, but it requires a 'performative turn' to move from an apologetic lecture to a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his seminary days; SAT reveals that this focus actually weakens the divine illocution.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the Cook Kimball story is a 'masterstroke' of pathos, but SAT shows it remains a constative report unless the preacher uses it to perform a present blessing.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'crisis' of the sermon is not the lack of stories, but the surplus of assertives that keep the hearer at a distance from the 'event' of grace.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: It is an announcement about events that happened.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low; it talks about the announcement rather than being the announcement.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The inexorability of Death has been reversed.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High; this is the moment the sermon approaches 'event' status.

appendices.notities: The preacher relies heavily on the 'authority of the text' as a historical document rather than the 'authority of the office' to speak for God in the present.
